categories.description: Learn about pest control, disease management, and crop protection
questions: How to control aphids in crops?
What are signs of fungal diseases?
When to spray for pest control?

answers.How to control aphids in crops?: For aphid control: 1) Use neem oil spray (5ml/liter water), 2) Introduce ladybugs as natural predators, 3) Apply insecticidal soap, 4) Remove affected plant parts. Spray early morning or evening.
answers.What are signs of fungal diseases?: Common fungal disease signs: yellowing leaves, white powdery coating, dark spots on leaves, wilting despite adequate water, stunted growth. Early detection is key for effective treatment.
answers.Best organic pesticides available?: Effective organic options: Neem oil, Bacillus thuringiensis (Bt), diatomaceous earth, pyrethrin-based sprays, garlic-chili spray. Always follow application guidelines and safety measures.
answers.When to spray for pest control?: Best spraying times: Early morning (6-8 AM) or late evening (6-8 PM). Avoid midday heat and windy conditions. Check weather - no rain expected for 24 hours after application.

Market trends for rice this month?

answers.What are today's wheat prices?: Current wheat prices: ₹2,150-2,200 per quintal in major mandis. Prices are stable with slight upward trend. Quality wheat (moisture <12%) getting premium rates.
answers.Best time to sell my produce?: Market analysis suggests selling in next 2-3 weeks. Demand is increasing due to festival season. Avoid immediate post-harvest rush when prices typically dip.
answers.Market trends for rice this month?: Rice prices showing 5-8% increase this month. Basmati: ₹4,200-4,500/quintal, Non-basmati: ₹2,800-3,200/quintal. Export demand driving prices up.
answers.Where to get best prices nearby?: Top mandis in your region: 1) Central Mandi - ₹50-80 premium, 2) Cooperative Society - transparent pricing, 3) Direct buyer contacts available. Check transport costs before deciding.

categories.name: Government Schemes
categories.description: Information about government schemes and subsidies for farmers

answers.PM-KISAN Scheme details: PM-KISAN provides ₹6,000 per year in 3 installments of ₹2,000 each to eligible farmer families. Benefits are transferred directly to bank accounts. Apply online at pmkisan.gov.in with Aadhaar and land records.
answers.Crop Insurance benefits: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana covers crop losses due to natural disasters, pests, and diseases. Premium: 2% for Kharif, 1.5% for Rabi crops. Claim settlement within 60 days of harvest.
answers.Soil Health Card information: Free soil testing every 2 years providing nutrient status and fertilizer recommendations. Helps optimize fertilizer use and improve soil health. Contact nearest Krishi Vigyan Kendra for testing.
answers.Kisan Credit Card eligibility: Available to farmers, tenant farmers, oral lessees, and SHG members. Provides credit up to ₹3 lakh at 7% interest (4% with subsidy). Required: land documents, Aadhaar, PAN card.
